Text: Yes, Indeed however you can always extract with winrar ver 4 and up.

I just realized in FAQ which I have included I was not very clear about players and issues with decoding color info. I will break this in to two sections hopefully clear it out for you.

In regards official player(s) they would be Arcsoft TMT, Corel Windvd or Cyberlink PowerDVD.
If you choose one of them make sure it support blu-ray playback. Since files I give you are in blu-ray format and wrapped in ISO.

I also tried other player such VLC media player, Media Player classic home cinema and few others but they cause wash out of the picture. However this is not observed with official players. I would recommend sticking with one of the above players or using standalone blu-ray player.

This post is mainly geared towards mac user.

Due to the nature of file system used in ISO, it may not be possible to navigate contents of file within mac.  To fix this issue you can run MacOS X 10.5, or higher as it includes native support for file system.

If file system issue doesn’t matter to you or you can’t run OsX 10.5 or higher, you can use “DVDFAB Player” form “http://www.dvdfab.com”. I know it is shareware with 30 days trial, but for our purpose you can use it after 30 day trial as well without any crack. 

You can also use it even if you can see contents of the ISO file as it does not cause washout of the picture. I tried window version any it plays without any issue, based on that I assuming it should work on mac based version as well.
